page.title: 18BUILDING A HOUSE
page.content: AN ARCHITECT DESIGNS THE HOUSE, THE BUILDERS PREPARE THE SITE BY MAKING THE GROUND LEVEL. THE FOREMAN PEGS OUT THE PLAN OF THE HOUSE AND THE MEN DIG OUT THE TRENCH. THEY USE ABOUT 1O,OOO BRICKS FOR EACH HOUSE. THEY THEN POUR CONCRETE INTO THE TRENCH THIS IS THE FOUNDATION OF THE HOUSE. BRICK LAYERS BUILD THE WALLS OF THE HOUSE. JOINERS PUT UP THE WOODEN FRAMEWORK OF THE ROOF AND OTHER WOODEN PARTS OF THE HOUSE. TILES ARE THEN PUT ON THE ROOF.ELECTRICIANS BRING IN ELECTRICITY FROM THE MAINS. GAS FITTERS BRING IN GAS FROM THE MAINS. THE PLUMBER INSTALLS THE WATER PIPES. THE PLASTERER PLASTERS THE WALLS TO MAKE THEM SMOOTH. WHEN THE WALL GETS TOO HIGH FOR THE BUILDERS TO BUILD ON THEY BUILD SCAFFOLDING AROUND THE HOUSE. THE GLAZIER PUTS IN THE WINDOWS.
